content:
• Monday, August 25, 2014
  • CMTL

    Comtech confirms strategic review; shares +3.8% AH

    • Comtech (NASDAQ:CMTL) says it's "exploring strategic alternatives to enhance shareholder value, including a possible merger or sale of the Company."
    • No timetable has been set for finishing the review.  Shares are higher after coming off a halt.
    • Earlier: Comtech reportedly exploring sale, receives preliminary interest
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM
  • DGLY

    Digital Ally remains on a tear

    • Digital Ally (DGLY +57.4%) is now up 289% since the Aug. 14 close on expectations the unrest in Ferguson, MO will boost demand for the company's wearable law enforcement cameras. Its market cap is at $21.7M.
    • CEO Stanton Ross tells Reuters DGLY has been receiving offers "all the time," but won't provide details until a commitment letter has been signed.
    • Short-sellers are jumping in: 68% of shares available for borrowing have been lent to shorts, according to Markit.
    • Previous: Digital Ally nearly doubles amid Ferguson events
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 3 Comments

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: KITE +28.9%. ACHN +6.2%. CISG +5.2%. ARWR +3.0%. VRA +2.5%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: KANG -16.1%. XUE -13.2%. DUST -2.3%. QRE -1.7%. BBEP -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • PSEC

    Prospect Capital results hurt by slow origination activity

    • FQ4 net investment income of $84.1M or $0.25 per share is well south of expectations for $0.32 and stands against $98.5M and $0.31 one year ago. Originations slipped to $444M in FQ4 from $1.3B a quarter previous.
    • The quarterly dividend is roughly $0.33 per share.
    • The debt-to-equity ratio of 72.9% is up from 67.9% at the end of last quarter and 55.7% a year ago. Annualized yield of portfolio of 12.1% slides 40 basis points from the March quarter.
    • Net asset value of $10.56 per share slips from $10.68 at end of March quarter. Today's closing stock price was $10.98.
    • Conference call at 11 ET
    • Previously: Prospect Capital misses by $0.07, misses on revenue
    • PSEC -1.9% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM | 14 Comments
  • KITE

    Kite Pharma +35% following non-Hodgkin's lymphoma drug study result

    • Kite Pharma (NASDAQ:KITE) +34.5% AH after announcing positive results in a clinical study of patients receiving Kite's treatment for non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.
    • The clinical trial funded by Kite and conducted by the Surgery Branch of the National Cancer Institute found that in 12 of 13 evaluable patients with advanced B-cell malignancies receiving Kite's anti-CD19 CAR T cell therapy resulted in complete remission in eight patients and partial remission in four patients.
    • Based on the study, Kite says it plans to file an Investigational New Drug Application during Q4.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • ADEP

    Adept -19.1% AH on FQ4 miss; U.S. issues blamed

    • Adept (NASDAQ:ADEP) attributes its soft FQ4 results to a major sales decline for its U.S. fixed robot business. The company says it has "taken several actions to improve performance in the U.S., including new leadership and go to market strategies."
    • European sales were healthier, growing 27%. In addition, Adept says certain initial orders from new mobile robot customers "have the potential to turn into very large opportunities."
    • Gross margin rose 30 bps Y/Y to 46.3%. Opex rose by $300K to $7.1M - SG&A spend totaled $5.3M, and R&D spend $1.6M. Adept ended FQ4 with $7.8M in cash.
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • CMTL

    Reuters: Comtech exploring sale, receives preliminary interest

    • Reuters reports Comtech (CMTL +4.8%) is "exploring a potential sale and has received preliminary expressions of interest in recent weeks."
    • Citi is said to be advising the telecom equipment maker, which has mulled a sale at times in the past. Shares spiked shortly before the close on the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • BITA

    Bitauto, Autohome soar to new highs

    • Bitauto (BITA +11.4%) and rival Chinese online car marketplace Autohome (ATHM +12.4%) have soared to new highs on strong volume.
    • Shares of both companies have been buoyed this month by solid Q2 reports (I, II). Bitauto also received a lift from its plans to form a JV aimed at the high-end Chinese used car market.
    • Bitauto now +185% YTD. Autohome +52%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • GEF

    Greif cuts full-year guidance on higher costs, weaker results

    • Greif (GEF -4.7%) has been sharply lower all day after cutting its FY 2014 earnings outlook, warning of higher expenses and weaker than expected operational results for the rest of the year.
    • The industrial packaging company now sees full-year earnings of $1.98-$2.08 per Class A share vs. its earlier guidance of $2.48-$2.80 per Class A share, and expects to write down $48.4M for Q3 stemming from its "actions to strengthen its business portfolio."
    • Greif already had cut its earnings outlook in June when reporting Q2 earnings, when it said it expected the "slow motion global economic recovery" to continue during the rest of its fiscal year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • WPX

    WPX Energy +2.5% after Howard Weil upgrade

    • WPX Energy (WPX +2.5%) is upgraded to Sector Outperform from Sector Perform with a $32 price target, up from $25, at Howard Weil, which says WPX continues its turnaround story with outstanding Q2 results.
    • Q2 was the first quarter directed by new CEO Rick Muncrief, and the outlook is already much improved; oil production was ahead of estimates, costs are declining, Gallup results are improving, and the more simplified company is heading in the right direction, Weil says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • SNP

    Sinopec shortlists 37 bidders for stake sale in retail unit

    • Sinopec (SNP +2.6%) says 37 companies have expressed interest in investing in its spinoff of 30% of its gas station business, but a skeptical WSJ Heard on the Street column says early signs of hoped-for reforms are not encouraging.
    • Instead of boosting efficiency, SNP so far looks like it is reorganizing its priorities and raising capital, Abheek Bhattacharya writes; if this is as good as it gets for SNP's reforms, China investors should brace for disappointment.
    • Shares are up nicely, however, after Chairman Fu Chengyu, in discussing SNP's 8% Y/Y rise in H1 profit, said he expects shale drilling costs in China to drop to $50M/well from $80M in three to five years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • SPEX

    Spherix higher after announcing timeline for Verizon suit

    • A pretrial conference for Spherix's (SPEX +3.4%) infringement suit against Verizon is set for Sep. 10, and pre-trial discovery is to be completed by Dec. 12. The trial itself will start 4-8 weeks after the final pre-trial conference, which is set for Dec. 18.
    • Spherix is asserting Nortel patents obtained through its deal with the Rockstar Consortium. The company claims Verizon's Internet services, including its FiOS and VoIP offerings, infringe the patents.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • EBIX

    Ebix rallies on buyback announcement

    • Ebix (EBIX +3.9%) says it plans to buy back up to $80M worth of shares over the next 12 months. The company also states it has repurchased 471K shares since June 30, bringing its diluted count down to 38.2M.
    • Ebix had only $34.3M in cash and short-term investments at the end of Q2. Debt totaled $37.1M. A recently-closed $150M credit facility could be used on buybacks, at the cost of increasing debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 5 Comments
  • QSR

    Rocket ride of Burger King Worldwide stirs up some doubters

    • Shares of Burger King Worldwide (BKW) are still on an uphill climb, up 24.9% to $33.89 on volume 3000X normal trading activity.
    • The rally looks outsized to some restaurant analysts who think fundamentals and synergies don't support the elevated share price. Plans for financial engineering and tax benefits could hit potholes down the road, they warn.
    • There's also the chance that a bidding war could erupt for Tim Hortons and force Burger King to dig deeper, notes SA contributor Stock Traders Daily.
    • BKW-THI timeline
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • QIHU

    Qihoo -8.6%; margin drop overshadows Q2 beat

    • Though Qihoo (NYSE:QIHU) beat Q2 estimates and offered above-consensus Q3 sales guidance, its gross margin fell to 79.1% from 79.5% in Q1 and 88.3% a year ago. In addition, opex rose 19% Q/Q and 114% Y/Y to $208.3M on the back of a 254% Y/Y increase in sales/marketing spend.
    • Online ad revenue +22.3% Q/Q and +89% Y/Y to $171.3M thanks to search and mobile ad growth. Internet value-added service revenue +17.2% Q/Q and +140% Y/Y thanks to PC/mobile gaming growth.
    • Total monthly active users of Qihoo's PC products totaled 496M in June, up from 497M in March and 461M a year ago. Smartphone users of Qihoo's 360 Mobile Safe app rose to 641M from 538M in March and 338M a year ago.
    • Daily unique visitors for Qihoo's 360 browser home page grew to 128M in Q2 from 122M in Q1 and 114M a year ago. Average daily clicks for the page grew totaled 749M, up from 590M a year ago but down from 772M in Q1.
    • Citi estimates PC search revenue (boosted by share gains) rose 52% Q/Q to $62M (20% of total revenue), and that mobile revenue rose 16% Q/Q to $68M, with 67% coming from games. At the same time, it expects heavy spend to result in op. margin falling to 25% in 2014 from 34% in 2013.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: DGLY +53%. ITMN +35%. OTC:NLST +21%. THI +21%. BKW +20%. ADXS +18%. OTC:DSKX +14%. OTC:CALI +14%. HGSH +13%. CEP +11%.
    • Top 10 Losers: NTWK -12%. HTBX -11%. TIGR -11%. QIHU -8%. KWK -8%. MCP -8%. IPAS -8%. REX -7%. OTC:PRKR -7%. CDZI -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural +3% on plan for $200M share buyback

    • Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +3.2%) pops higher after announcing plans for a $200M share reourchase program, active through year-end 2015.
    • CLF also says former CEO Gary Halverson has resigned from the CLF board.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 10 Comments
  • MOBL

    MobileIron jumps; Deutsche sees iOS 8 as a catalyst

    • Citing checks, Deutsche's Karl Keirstead thinks iOS 8's enterprise security and device management features providing a boost to MobileIron (MOBL +7.4%) by motivating companies to replace their BlackBerrys.
    • Keirstead observes iOS 8 (due this fall) extends current data encryption features to e-mail and 3rd-party apps, provides more granular app/document content control, and opens up Apple's Touch ID fingerprint sensor to developers. He also mentions a talk with a mobile IT head at an enterprise planning a "partial migration away from BlackBerry."
    • Worth noting: 1) BlackBerry's share of enterprise hardware activations has already plunged. 2) Many other MDM software vendors (VMware, Citrix, SAP, Good Technology, etc.) are targeting the same opportunity.
    • Previous: MobileIron, SuperCom rally on coverage launches
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 6 Comments
  • TAST

    Largest Burger King franchisee trades higher

    • Carrols Restaurant Group (TAST +6.5%) trades higher after Stephens upgrades the company to a Buy rating.
    • The company is in focus as the largest franchisee of Burger King restaurants.
    • Currently, Carrols operates 528 BK outlets in the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • CBOE

    CBOE Holdings boosted by upgrade

    • Raymond James buys the small dip in CBOE Holdings (CBOE +3.4%) lifting the name to Outperform from Market Perform. Prior to today's move higher, CBOE was off about 10% from an all-time high reached in mid-March.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • GRUB

    GrubHub halted with news pending

    • GrubHub (NYSE:GRUB) has been halted.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • X

    South Korea promises action against U.S. steel tariffs

    • South Korea is vowing to take action against U.S. anti-dumping tariffs imposed on South Korean steel pipes and tubes for oil drilling, as it worries about the impact on the country's $818M/year export of the products to the U.S.
    • The ITC's confirmation of the tariffs last week is widely seen as a victory for U.S. steelmakers, especially U.S. Steel (X +2.6%), who say South Korean and other foreign competitors sold their products below cost to boost their market share in the U.S.
    • South Korea could file a complaint to a U.S. court or take action at the WTO to get the punitive U.S. tariffs nullified, but analysts say the dispute isn't likely to escalate quickly.
    • ETF: SLX
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • TXRH

    Another bullish call on Texas Roadhouse

    • Shares of Texas Roadhouse (TXRH +2%) get a lift from an upgrade by Stephens to Overweight.
    • The company has one of the higher ratios of Street Buy/Overweight ratings in the restaurant sector as it continues to outcomp many of its peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • IPHI

    Netlist +26.2%; USPTO denies InPhi patent challenge

    • In a final decision, the USPTO has denied an InPhi (NYSE:IPHI) request for a rehearing on a ruling affirming the validity of a Netlist (OTC:NLST) patent related to LRDIMM server memory modules. (USPTO filing)
    • Netlist asserts the patent's claims are "integral to the design" of LRDIMMs, which enable CPUs to handle more memory than traditional RDIMMs, with DDR3 and DDR4 interfaces.
    • The patent is the subject of a California infringement suit filed by Netlist against InPhi. InPhi can still appeal the USPTO decision to a federal appeals court; the deadline for doing so is mid-October.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • TRP

    Barron's: TransCanada is attractive alternative to U.S. MLPs, could rise 35%

    • TransCanada (TRP +1.7%) opens higher after a favorable weekend report from Barron's, which says that even without the $5.4B Keystone XL pipeline, the company boasts an industry-leading $30B backlog of projects in the works.
    • TRP shares aren't cheap based on reported earnings, trading at ~23x estimated 2014 after-tax profit, but TRP has a strong growth outlook - management sees EBITDA nearly doubling by the end of the decade - and the shares fetch just 12x estimated 2015 EBITDA.
    • Investors have given TRP little credit for its conservative dividend policy, which pays out a third of its cash flow in dividends while retaining funds to reinvest in its capital program.; there's speculation that TRP, whose current investor base is dominated by Canadian institutional holders, could attract a U.S. activist investor who would push for a more generous dividend and a separation of the pipeline and power-generating assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 3 Comments
  • XGTI

    xG Technology +11.4% on Roth launch

    • Roth has launched coverage on xG Technology (NASDAQ:XGTI) with a Buy and $5 target.
    • Shares are at their highest levels since the beginning of the month.
    • Previous: xG Technology gains on CACI subcontract
     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • FEYE

    RJ calls FireEye, Fortinet potential H-P M&A targets

    • Raymond James thinks H-P could acquire FireEye (NASDAQ:FEYE) or Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) to expand its enterprise security position.
    • Remarks made in H-P's FQ3 CC last week about the presence of "material non-public information" have fueled M&A speculation. UBS named Rackspace as a potential target on Friday, but re/code soon followed up by reporting H-P is still uninterested in the company. The enterprise security space has seen plenty of M&A activity over the last two years.
    • SA Pro author David Hernandez offered a bullish take on FireEye on Friday, arguing (among other things) the company's threat-prevention platform is differentiated by a superior virtual sandbox for analyzing/executing potentially malicious code.
    • FEYE +2.3%. FTNT unchanged for now.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 6 Comments
  • MCD

    'All-American' McDonald's higher as Burger King looks north

    • Shares of McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) are higher in premarket trading, showing little anxiety over a potential merger between Burger King and Tim Hortons.
    • Despite the threat of an expansion of the Tim Hortons chain, restaurant sector analysts see an opportunity for the marketing mavens at McDonald's to get quite busy with an "All-American" message to consumers.
    • MCD +0.4% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • LTM-OLD

    REIT plan on the table at Life Time Fitness

    • Life Time Fitness (NYSE:LTM-OLD) announces that it's exploring a potential conversion of its assets into a REIT.
    • The company says a new shareholder rights plan has been approved to limit ownership to 9.8% of shares so that the REIT plan can be implemented.
    • LTM +10.3% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ITMN +36%. XGTI +19%. THI +17%. DGLY +16%. BKW +14%. LTM-OLD +10%.
    • Losers: QIHU -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • PEP

    PepsiCo higher after Barron's cover piece

    • Shares of PepsiCo (NYSE:PEP) are higher in early action after Barron's stokes up the snacks-beverages split discussion again with a cover story.
    • Though the reasons for a business separation cover old Nelson Peltz ground, the piece makes the point that PepsiCo has been responding to the investor pressure through deeper cost-cutting and efficiency initiatives.
    • PEP +1.1% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM | 2 Comments
  • TBRA

    Regado plunges premarket after Revolixys trial permanently axed

    • Shares of nano cap Regado Biosciences (RGDO) plunge 43% premarket on moderately high volume after it announced the permanent termination of patient enrollment in its Phase 3 clinical trial of Revolixys Kit evaluating its safety and efficacy versus bivalirudin in patients with acute coronary syndromes undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention.
    • The company based its decision on the recommendation of the Data and Safety Monitoring Board (DSMD) after it completed its analysis of the results from the first 3,250 patients in the trial. The DSMD found that the level of serious allergic adverse events associated with Revolixys was to too high to recommend proceeding.
    • Regado initiated a voluntary halt to patient enrollment in July after the FDA implemented a clinical hold based on the unacceptably high incidence of severe allergic reactions.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • WEN

    Wendy's on the move after Burger King-Tim Hortons news

    • Shares of Wendy's (NYSE:WEN) are on the move in premarket trading after Burger King discloses talks with Tim Hortons.
    • The company spun off Tim Hortons in 2006 and in Canada still has a number of combined unit locations.
    • WEN +1.8% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • LAYN

    Investor seeks reorganization at Layne Christensen

    • Layne Christensen's (NASDAQ:LAYN) largest shareholder, Van Den Berg Management I, discloses a 16.2% stake in the drilling services company and is seeking a reorganization.
    • The investment adviser says it made a presentation to LAYN management earlier this month urging a reorganization that would include the evaluation of each business division and the potential divestment of a division, whose proceeds would be used to pay down debt and initiate a share buyback program.
    • LAYN +1.9% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • JCP

    JPMorgan warms up to long-term outlook on J.C. Penney

    • JPMorgan tees up J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) as a Long Trade Idea.
    • The investment firm thinks JCP will announce a restructuring this fall that will spark a rally as earnings projections starts to look more manageable.
    • JP was cautious heading into J.C. Penney's Q2 report, but emerged confident on the other side and with Q3 channel checks looking promising.
    • JCP +2.4% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM | 7 Comments
  • QSR

    Tim Hortons soars off Burger King interest, Starbucks challenge on tap?

    • A strategic reason for Burger King Worldwide (BKW) to snap up Tim Hortons (THI) is the potential for the company to use its deep global development experience to help the coffee chain grow in new global markets
    • That plan could see Tim Hortons compete against Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) in more regions, including a deeper foray into the U.S.
    • Shares of Tim Hortons (THI) are flying in premarket trading, up 17.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • X

    U.S. Steel jumps premarket on Credit Suisse upgrade

    • U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) +2.6% premarket after Credit Suisse upgrades shares to Outperform from Underperform and raises its price target to $50 from $25, believing U.S. Steel is on the cusp of a multi-billion dollar earnings opportunity driven by raw material cost advantages and a supportive macro environment.
    • Credit Suisse says the company's ability to produce direct reduced iron using vertically integrated iron ore allowing it to produce low cost steel and the macro environment of demand strength, trade cases and consolidation should allow for better supply side rationalization and pricing.
    • Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) -1.7% premarket, after the firm downgrades shares to Neutral from Outperform due to valuation and keeps its price target at $23.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 AM | 1 Comment

  • Futures climb as Europe rallies

    • While Janet Yellen talked rate hikes at Jackson Hole, her ECB counterpart Mario Draghi talked additional stimulus measures, and Europe's Stoxx 50 is up by 1%, led by Italy's 1.1% gain.
    • S&P 500 and DJIA futures are ahead by 0.35% and Nasdaq 100 by 0.4%.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is down three basis points at 2.38% and gold is lower by $2 per ounce to $1,278.
    • ETFs: SPY, QQQ, SH, DIA, SSO, SDS, VOO, PSQ, IVV, SPXU, UPRO, TQQQ, SPXL, QID, RSP, SQQQ, DOG, QLD, DXD, RWL, EPS, UDOW, SDOW, DDM, BXUB, QQEW, QQQE, SPLX, SFLA, BXUC, QQXT, SPUU
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 AM
  • QSR

    More on the potential Burger King Worldwide-Tim Hortons merger

    • Shares of Burger King Worldwide (BKW) shoot higher in early trading after the company confirms it's in talks to buy Canadian restaurant operator Tim Horton (THI).
    • Combined, the two restaurant chains operate 18K outlets and churn up $22B in sales.
    • The early take from restaurant analysts is that the merger could create enormous synergies, although a hit to the Burger King brand would be risked by relocating its headquarters to Canada to seek out lower taxes.
    • 3G Capital is the majority owner of Burger King.
    • BKW +7.0% premarket to $29.01.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 AM
